_header: Sweet leman I die for thy love
Title(s): ‘Vox Christi in cruce et Responsus peccatoris’
Subjects: Christ, appeal of, to man; dialogues
_description: ‘Vox Christi in cruce et Responsus peccatoris’ — five short couplets

BodDig55.First Lines:
Swete leman y deye for þi loveyf y deye for
                    þe…
BodDig55.Last Lines:
…þin ore, þin ore mi swete lemansore me reues that y
                    ave misdon
BodDig55.Editions:
Thomson,  S. Harrison. 
             “The Date of the Early English Translation of the ‘Candet nudatum
                pectus.’” 
             Medium Ævum
         4 (1935): 100-5: 105.
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 36.
